watermelon_details.description: Watermelon is a large, vine-like flowering plant originally from southern Africa. It is prized for its juicy, sweet flesh and high water content, making it a popular summertime fruit.
watermelon_details.nutritional value: Watermelon is low in calories and fat but high in vitamins A and C, as well as antioxidants like lycopene. It helps to keep the body hydrated and supports overall health.
watermelon_details.uses: Fresh consumption, Juicing, Salads, Sorbet, Smoothies
watermelon_details.varieties: Crimson Sweet, Sugar Baby, Charleston Gray, Yellow Doll, Orangeglo
watermelon_details.harvesting: Watermelons are typically harvested when the underside of the fruit turns yellow or cream-colored and the stem begins to dry out.
watermelon_details.ripeness indicator: A ripe watermelon will have a hollow sound when tapped, a firm texture, and a dull, matte appearance on the rind.
watermelon_details.harvest season: Watermelons are harvested in the summer months, usually from late June to early September, depending on the region and variety.

prerequisites.soil: Watermelons prefer well-drained, sandy or loamy soil with good fertility and a slightly acidic to neutral pH (around 6.0 to 7.0).
prerequisites.climate: Watermelons thrive in warm climates with temperatures between 70°F to 90°F (21°C to 32°C) during the growing season.
prerequisites.sunlight: Watermelons require full sunlight for optimal growth and fruit development.
prerequisites.water: Watermelons need regular watering, especially during flowering and fruit development, to keep the soil consistently moist but not waterlogged.
prerequisites.space: Plant watermelon seeds or seedlings in hills or rows with spacing ranging from 3 to 5 feet apart.
